alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Juniata; Mifflin; Northumberland; Perry; Snyder (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 5:05AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...AN AREA OF MODERATE SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF PERRY... NORTHUMBERLAND...JUNIATA...DAUPHIN...MIFFLIN...AND SNYDER COUNTIES... HAZARDS...An area of moderate snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile and result in a coating to 1 inch of accumulation. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 502 AM EST, a moderate snow shower was near Selinsgrove moving east at 25 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Sunbury, Selinsgrove, Northumberland, Winfield, Millersburg, Trevorton, Lykens, Shamokin Dam, Elizabethville, Williamstown, Hummels Wharf, Middleburg, Mcalisterville, McClure, Kreamer, Port Trevorton, Penns Creek, Beaver Springs, Richfield and Mount Pleasant Mills. This includes the following highways... Routes 11 and 15 from SOUTH OF LIVERPOOL to NEAR SHAMOKIN DAM. Routes 22 and 322 near east of Thompsontown. Route 209 from Millersburg to near Williamstown. Route 522 from east of Alfarata to Selinsgrove. State Road 61 near Sunbury. State Highway 147 from Sunbury to Sunbury. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this area of snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Dauphin; Juniata; Mifflin; Northumberland; Perry; Snyder
